messageBody:
Brian Denny wrote:
> J.B. Rainsberger wrote:

>
>>JUnit is not a codepath analysis tool; it is a tool for expressing
>
> black-box
>
>>tests at the class level.
>
> </snip>
>
> okay, i'm confused about "black box" and "white box" testing.

Quick summary:

Black Box is treating the object as an unmodifiable entity. You have no
access to the internals of the object. Therefore, you cannot modify its
state--but merely give it input and check its output.

White Box is treating the object as a modifiable entity. You have
access to the internals of the object. You may modify its state, or
verify the internal state of the object is what is expected at all
times.

It is better to do Black Box testing for sanity checks and regression
tests on classes. It makes it easier to change *how* the object does
its job without breaking the test.

One example of white box testing is stepping through the object
execution code with a debugger. SOme tools have ways of testing the
internals of your object using Proxy objects. However, if your test
breaks because the class was restructured, you have to rewrite your
test.
